items.description: River Thames and its tributaries from Days Lock to above Pangbourne

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Thames, Lady Brook, Ewelme Stream, Mill Brook, West Hagbourne Stream, Hakkas Brook, Cholsey Brook, Kibble Ditch

items.message:
This Flood Alert has been removed. 
River levels have now fallen below the flood risk threshold and continue to slowly fall. The forecast is for a predominantly dry day today (08/04/2023) with showers developing tomorrow afternoon. 
We continue to monitor the situation and will re-issue this alert if necessary.
Please remain safe and aware of your local surroundings and avoid contact with standing water that may remain on the floodplain.

Flooding is possible in this area. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. Avoid using low lying footpaths or entering areas prone to flooding. Start acting on your flood plan if you have one. Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.description: River Thames and tributaries in the Oxford area
items.message:
Flooding is expected in this area. This means properties are at risk of flooding.    

Please take action to protect yourself and your property and monitor local weather and river conditions. Avoid contact with, walking or driving through flood water. Consider activating any property flood protection products you may have.    

Environment Agency Flood Warning Officers set the river or tidal levels that have triggered this message. During industrial action this message has been automatically issued based on rising river or tidal levels.

items.description: Mansbridge and Woodmill on the River Itchen
Wymans Brook from Wymans to Pittville, Cheltenham
items.message: River levels remain below the flood risk threshold. There is no longer a threat of flooding. No further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours.  We continue to monitor the situation.
